title: Flask 2.3.1 leads to pyload crash on build from develop branch
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

pyLoad-ng develop branch build with Flask 2.3.1 (just released) leads to crash on start

### Debug log
<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

```
[2023-04-26 06:06:26]  INFO                pyload  *** Welcome to pyLoad 0.5.0 ***
[2023-04-26 06:06:26]  DEBUG               pyload  Indexing plugins...
[2023-04-26 06:06:26]  INFO                pyload  Activated addons: ClickNLoad, ExternalScripts, TORRENT, UnSkipOnFail, UserAgentSwitcher
[2023-04-26 06:06:26]  INFO                pyload  Deactivate addons: AndroidPhoneNotify, AntiCaptcha, AntiStandby, AntiVirus, AppriseNotify, BypassCaptcha, Captcha9Kw, Checksum, CloudFlareDdos, DeathByCaptcha, DeleteFinished, DiscordNotifier, DownloadScheduler, ExpertDecoders, ExtractArchive, HotFolder, IRC, ImageTyperz, JustPremium, LinkFilter, LogMarker, MergeFiles, MultiHome, PushBullet, PushOver, RestartFailed, SkipRev, TransmissionRPC, UpdateManager, WindowsPhoneNotify, XFileSharing, XMPP
AttributeError: module 'flask.json' has no attribute 'JSONEncoder'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/pyload", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyload/__main__.py", line 292, in main
    run(core_args, args.daemon, args.pidfile)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyload/__main__.py", line 235, in run
    pyload_core = Core(*core_args)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyload/core/__init__.py", line 105, in __init__
    self._init_webserver()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyload/core/__init__.py", line 168, in _init_webserver
    from pyload.webui.webserver_thread import WebServerThread
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyload/webui/webserver_thread.py", line 9, in <module>
    from .app import App
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyload/webui/app/__init__.py", line 17, in <module>
    from .blueprints import BLUEPRINTS
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyload/webui/app/blueprints/__init__.py", line 11, in <module>
    from .app_blueprint import bp as app_bp
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyload/webui/app/blueprints/app_blueprint.py", line 17, in <module>
    from ..helpers import (
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyload/webui/app/helpers.py", line 11, in <module>
    class JSONEncoder(flask.json.JSONEncoder):
AttributeError: module 'flask.json' has no attribute 'JSONEncoder'
```

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

### Additional references
<!-- Any other reference, related issues or pull requests about this report. -->

This is running in the Linuxserver.io docker image: https://github.com/linuxserver/docker-pyload-ng/tree/develop

Not sure if this is a pyload issue or a flask issue. I wanted to bring it up here first and if it is upstream, please let me know and I'll move it over there.

### Screenshots
<!-- Any screenshot that can help to explain your problem. -->

N/A


Thanks

PS. Here is the build report on the latest commit to develop branch: https://ci-tests.linuxserver.io/linuxserver/pyload-ng/develop-2c5d66b4-ls228/index.html

title: GoogledriveCom plugin with bigger file doesn't download properly
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->
I'm trying to download a file with ~4.8GB size which I can't share the link. The URL is in the proper format, something like this: 
`https://drive.google.com/uc?id=<id>&export=download.` The GoogledriveCom plugin is able to detect the confirmation link, which is passed to the download stack. The final link is something like this: `https://drive.google.com/uc?<id>&export=download&confirm=<confirm>`. The downloaded file finished very fast and checking the result, it's the html file of the "Google Drive can't scan this file for viruses." page. If I use the final link, with the confirmation uid, at a browser, the download starts normally. I was trying to debug this, and it seems that the pycurl.curl may not be treating the URL params properly (all & variables) since it falls to the confirmation page.

I'm not using a premium account here.

<!-- WRITE HERE -->

### Debug log
<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

```

title: No module named 'pyload.core.config' when installing pip install pyload-ng
body:
### Description
I have a new installed Raspberry Pi4 on bullseye.
I tried to install "pip install pyload-ng"
When trying to start pyload I get:
 No module named 'filetype'

After installing filetype with "pip install filetype" and try gain to start pyload I get:
 No module named 'pyload.core.config'

I had this problem long time ago on my raspberry pi3. I solved it somehow.
But now I have no idea anymore what to do.

I found some references here but they seem to be outdated.
eg.: https://github.com/pyload/pyload/issues/3540
and: https://github.com/pyload/pyload/issues/3428#issuecomment-522275713

On my PI3 i have 0.5.0 running but do not remember how i got it working.
I also checked on the PI3 and it is using python3.9.

Should be possible on PI4 too. 

Can you help me solve the issue?

Thanks,
Stefan

title: Retry triggered by hoster doesn't grab the common link infos again which leads to DID as filename
body:
### Description
In case a download retry will be caused by a hoster plugin (e.g. via `self.retry(...)` due to unavailable free slots) it's possible that this leads to queue- and filenames derived from the download ID. This information is still availabe as long as the download is online and it should be parsed from the received html content, but it wouldn't any longer.
As long as I understood the chain right this will be done only (via `grab_info()`) in case the info state changes (see [simple_downloader.py#L269](https://github.com/pyload/pyload/blob/main/src/pyload/plugins/base/simple_downloader.py#L269)), which wouldn't be touched in this scenario. Since the [download_thread.py#L37](https://github.com/pyload/pyload/blob/main/src/pyload/core/threads/download_thread.py#L37) clears the pyfile in every cycle it does this after the retry has been [raised](https://github.com/pyload/pyload/blob/main/src/pyload/core/threads/download_thread.py#L88) as exception too. So in the second retry cycle it could already been possible that not the real filename will be applied, but the DID as name instead...which is bad for split archives.

title: clicknupload links using default plugin
body:
Hi,

After my other issue #4212 was fixed yesterday I moved to the next branch and develop tag via LinuxServer.io’s docker image. I’m noticing that when adding a link from clicknupload, the default plugin is being picked up and it’s downloading the page html:

```
2856 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | INFO | pyload | Download starts: httpsclicknupload.toxxxxxx
2857 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | DEBUG | pyload | ADDON UserAgentSwitcher: Setting connection timeout to 60 seconds
2858 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | DEBUG | pyload | ADDON UserAgentSwitcher: Setting maximum redirections to 10
2859 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | DEBUG | pyload | ADDON UserAgentSwitcher: Use custom user-agent string `Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:87.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/87.0`
2860 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | DEBUG | pyload | ADDON ExternalScripts: No script found under folder `download_preparing`
2861 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | DEBUG | pyload | DOWNLOADER DefaultPlugin[27]: Plugin version: 0.52
2862 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | DEBUG | pyload | DOWNLOADER DefaultPlugin[27]: Plugin status: testing
2863 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | WARNING | pyload | DOWNLOADER DefaultPlugin[27]: Plugin may be unstable
2864 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | DEBUG | pyload | DOWNLOADER DefaultPlugin[27]: Config option `use_premium` not found, use default `True`
2865 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | INFO | pyload | DOWNLOADER DefaultPlugin[27]: Grabbing link info...
2866 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | DEBUG | pyload | DOWNLOADER DefaultPlugin[27]: Link info: {'name': 'xcxxxxx', 'hash': {}, 'pattern': {}, 'size': 0, 'status': 7, 'url': 'https://clicknupload.to/xxxxx'}
2867 | 2022-10-27 21:44:40 | DEBUG | pyload | DOWNLOADER DefaultPlugin[27]: Previous link info: {}

title: Anticaptcha not working - ‘url’ key error
body:
Hi,

I’m running the latest stable image in docker on a Debian Linux based host. I’m trying to get a captcha service up and working and am having issues with AntiCaptcha and it’s plugin. The error is below:

```
apidgatorNet[6]: Processing url: https://rapidgator.net/file/XXXX
26.10.2022 21:44:48 INFO      HOSTER RapidgatorNet[6]: Looking for direct download link...
26.10.2022 21:44:49 INFO      HOSTER RapidgatorNet[6]: Direct download link not found
26.10.2022 21:44:49 INFO      HOSTER RapidgatorNet[6]: Checking for link errors...
26.10.2022 21:44:49 INFO      HOSTER RapidgatorNet[6]: No errors found
26.10.2022 21:44:49 INFO      HOSTER RapidgatorNet[6]: Processing as free download...
26.10.2022 21:44:49 INFO      HOSTER RapidgatorNet[6]: Waiting 3 minutes...
26.10.2022 21:47:51 WARNING   CAPTCHA RapidgatorNet[6]: ReCaptcha | Key pattern not found
26.10.2022 21:47:52 INFO      CAPTCHA RapidgatorNet[6]: SolveMedia | Using OCR to decrypt captcha...
26.10.2022 21:47:52 WARNING   CAPTCHA RapidgatorNet[6]: SolveMedia | No OCR result
26.10.2022 21:47:54 INFO      ADDON AntiCaptcha: Credits left: 0.05$
Exception in thread Thread-46:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 801, in __bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/app/pyload/module/PluginThread.py", line 465, in run
    self.f(*self.args, **self.kwargs)
  File "/app/pyload/module/plugins/hooks/AntiCaptcha.py", line 64, in _process_captcha
    url_p = urlparse.urlparse(task.captchaParams["url"])
KeyError: 'url'
26.10.2022 21:52:54 WARNING   CAPTCHA RapidgatorNet[6]: SolveMedia | Invalid captcha | No captcha result obtained in appropriate timing (120s)
```

I’m new to pyload so not sure where to check from here. Any help would be very appreciated.

Thanks,

title: FilecryptCc: filecrypt.co domain is not supported
body:
- https://filecrypt.cc/Container/39D60046FC.html is handled by FilecryptCc plugin (works)
- https://filecrypt.co/Container/39D60046FC.html is handled by DefaultPlugin plugin (fails)

Apparently this was fixed in https://github.com/pyload/pyload/commit/7395ab80cc7247588597efb169b80ff3d45672a0 by looking for a JS redirect.
However, no such redirect happens anymore, the old domain simply works, too.

I'm currently manually rewriting links before adding to pyload to work around this issue - not an acceptable workflow.

title: FilecryptCc: Activating "Handle Mirror Pages" leads to multiple packages
body:
When adding an URL to filecrypt.cc, with "Handle Mirror Pages" enabled, the decryption will lead to new packages being created for each mirror. I don't think this is intentional?

Problems:

- All packages will share the same name.
- This is bad for using the pyload API (as the package you added via API is no longer the package you want to track).
- Makes it impossible to order / prioritize packages by mirror, because priority is per-package.
- Multiple progress bars (one per package) in the Web-UI for what should be a single package.

title: Packages with german umlauts don't get added via ClickNLoad
body:
### Description
When I try to ClickNLoad add the example below, where the link contains german umlauts (ä or ü in these cases), I get the log error below and the links are not added to the queue. Most of the time I only get the `Connection from *.*.*.*` debug message without anything else.

I tested the same process with some other links coming in via filecrypt from the same site without umlauts and they all work as expected.

I'm also aware of #3679 but hasn't helped with my case. And also that the problem might not even be with pyload.
Thanks in advance for taking a look.

### System
```
        Python: 2.7.16 (default, Oct 10 2019, 22:02:15) [GCC 8.3.0]
            OS: posix linux2 Linux downpi4 5.10.0-0.bpo.5-arm64 #1 SMP Debian 5.10.24-1~bpo10+1 (2021-03-29) aarch64
pyLoad version: 0.4.20 (commit f929ee9d88605bbc6daed9d770eb7caf2c6c051e on branch stable from 30th of July)

downpc python[12129]: DEBUG     ADDON ClickNLoad: Connection from 192.168.*.*:58834
downpc python[12129]: Database Error @ addPackage ('Gummib\xc3\xa4renbande.S02.GERMAN.720p.HDTV.x264-4SJ - filecrypt.cc', 'Gummib\xc3\xa4renbande.S02.GERMAN.720p.HDTV.x264-4SJ - filecrypt.cc', 0) {} You must not use 8-bit bytestrings unless you use a text_factory that can interpret 8-bit bytestrings (like text_factory = str). It is highly recommended that you instead just switch your application to Unicode strings.

title: TCP: request_sock_TCP: Possible SYN flooding on port X. Sending cookies. Check SNMP counters. (Web UI port)
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

dmesg shows this message

`TCP: request_sock_TCP: Possible SYN flooding on port X. Sending cookies. Check SNMP counters. `

for the web ui port.

Changing parameters in sysctl has no effects.
It must be hardcoded in pyload (TCP Listen Backlog?). Got this error with another python based program (deluge).
It doesn't cause any real problems in pyload. Anyway, it may be better to avoid this.

### Debug log
<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

```

title: ddownload.com Premium - Skipped files are reducing available traffic
body:
As stated in the title.

Just now i reduced my daily available traffic to 0 just with skipped download files. I as missing some parts in the download and restartet the whole queue. The parts missing were max 5gb in size.

I checked the logs and to my understandings, this must have something to do with the skipped files.

Could you please check the plugin? Maybe this behavior can be changed?

Thanks in advance!

title: CPU busy loop after NFO download
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description

The download of some nfos trigger a 100% CPU usage loop.

To make pyload work again, the link needs to be manually removed from files.db sqlite3 database, because it will redownload and trigger the bug again on restart.

Download link:

    http://procknight.duckdns.org/py/vice.s09e01.720p.web.h264-kogi.nfo

### Debug log
<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

title: ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement cryptography~=3.0 (from pyload-ng)
body:
on build i get the error

```
ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement cryptography~=3.0 (from pyload-ng) (from versions: none)
ERROR: No matching distribution found for cryptography~=3.0
```

this is on nixpkgs, where i cannot change the version of cryptography
and most packages have the latest version

in my case

```
$ nix repl
nix-repl> :l <nixpkgs> 
nix-repl> pkgs.python3Packages.cryptography.version
"36.0.2"
```

fixed by relaxing the version specs

```
sed -i 's/cryptography~=3.0/cryptography>=3.0/' setup.cfg
sed -i 's/Flask-Babel~=1.0/Flask-Babel>=1.0/' setup.cfg
```

maybe relax all versions

```
sed -i 's/~=/>=/' setup.cfg
```

title: ImportError: No module named pkg_resources
body:
error

```
  File "pyload/__init__.py", line 15, in <module>
    import pkg_resources
ImportError: No module named pkg_resources
```

fixed by adding `setuptools` to dependencies

title: API statusDownloads returns `true` instead of empty list
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
calling the API `statusDownloads` returns `true` instead of empty array if no download is available.
if any download is available an array/list is returned.

```
####statusDownloads()

Status off all currently running downloads.

Returns: list of DownloadStatus
```

### Expected
When calling the API and no download is available an empty list should be returned instead of a bool value.
In stable release this is working correctly.

title: turbobit.net don't use premium account
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

Hello!

### Description
turbobit.net, seems to work via dummy hoster plugin "XFileSharing", don't use premium account, falls back to free-download and ends up in "Free download failed | Max retries reached"

I restarted pyload, no luck this issue appearss since 2 days or so...

title: ImportError: cannot import name 'soft_unicode' from 'markupsafe'
body:
### Description
pyLoad fails to start with error message "ImportError: cannot import name 'soft_unicode' from 'markupsafe'". 

### Reason
`soft_unicode` was removed from markupsafe. See: https://markupsafe.palletsprojects.com/en/2.1.x/changes/#version-2-1-0

> Remove soft_unicode, which was previously deprecated. Use soft_str instead. [#261](https://github.com/pallets/markupsafe/pull/261)

### Solution
Use `soft_str` in code.

### Workaround for users
Installing markupsafe 2.0.1 until the bug is fixed: ` python -m pip install markupsafe==2.0.1`

title: Legacy decorator not working in the API
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

My application requires calls to the API and I would like to support both PyLoad and PyLoad-Ng. The legacy endpoints written in camel case (`checkURLs` for example) work well with PyLoad but do not work with PyLoad-Ng. I know that they now are in snake case (`checkURLs` became `check_urls` for example) but they should still work since the API script uses the `legacy` decorator like this:

https://github.com/pyload/pyload/blob/4b0c6b64fd7590a09bcf95866f7a29259a64ee04/src/pyload/core/api/__init__.py#L74-L84

https://github.com/pyload/pyload/blob/4b0c6b64fd7590a09bcf95866f7a29259a64ee04/src/pyload/core/api/__init__.py#L466-L484

Am I missing something ? Thank you.

title: UlozTo plugin: "failed a bytes-like object is required, not 'str'" error when assembling downloaded chunks
body: ### Description After downloading a large file (8 GB) from UlozTo with a premium account, a message `failed a bytes-like object is required, not 'str'` appears under each file in Queue tab. The chunks eventually got assembled into a final file, so that seems OK. A file name of downloaded file was unusual - `Something - eng /1080p, DTS 5.1/ favic@.mkv` and seems to have confused pyLoad into saving it as `favic@.mkv` instead (which creates a problem when multiple downloaded files end with `/ favic@.mkv`). ### Debug log I don't have one, I am using `lscr.io/linuxserver/pyload-ng:latest` docker. ``` ``` ### Additional references ### Screenshots Here is how it looks like.

title: ExtractArchive.py does not call `archive.list` with the correct password
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

In `ExtractArchive.py` `archive.list()` gets called without a password,
https://github.com/pyload/pyload/blob/0b7b6eec6eb35cb755f16a77646e4c6775d49dc5/src/pyload/plugins/addons/ExtractArchive.py#L516

which raises an exception in 
https://github.com/pyload/pyload/blob/0b7b6eec6eb35cb755f16a77646e4c6775d49dc5/src/pyload/plugins/extractors/SevenZip.py#L189
<!-- WRITE HERE -->

since the output of 7z for this operation is
```
Listing archive: archive.part01.rar


ERROR: archive.part01.rar : Can not open encrypted archive. Wrong password?
```

Based on my quick testing, passing the correct password with `archive.list(password)` (and potentially updating the password variable with the discovered password from the password list before that) instead has the desired effect and lets the post-extraction process continue as normal and delete files and change permissions as intended.

### Debug log
<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->
Note the call to `7z l` using an empty password.
```
20171 | 2022-01-30 12:53:30 | DEBUG | pyload | ADDON ExtractArchive: Extracting using password: password
-- | -- | -- | -- | --
20172 | 2022-01-30 12:53:30 | DEBUG | pyload | EXTRACTOR SevenZip: EXECUTE 7z x -scsUTF-8 -sccUTF-8 -bso0 -bsp1 -aos -xr!*.nfo -xr!*.DS_Store -xr!index.dat -xr!thumb.db -ppassword -o/downloads/ /downloads/archive.part01.rar
20173 | 2022-01-30 12:54:14 | DEBUG | pyload | EXTRACTOR SevenZip: EXECUTE 7z l -scsUTF-8 -sccUTF-8 -bso0 -bsp1 -aos -xr!*.nfo -xr!*.DS_Store -xr!index.dat -xr!thumb.db -p- /downloads/archive.part01.rar
20174 | 2022-01-30 12:54:14 | ERROR | pyload | ADDON ExtractArchive: archive.part01.rar \| Archive error \| Cannot open file
20175 | ? | ? | ? | Traceback (most recent call last):
20176 | ? | ? | ? | File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/plugins/addons/ExtractArchive.py", line 516, in _extract
20177 | ? | ? | ? | extracted_files = archive.files or archive.list()
20178 | ? | ? | ? | File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/plugins/extractors/SevenZip.py", line 190, in list
20179 | ? | ? | ? | raise ArchiveError(self._("Cannot open file"))
```

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

# Other Info
I'm using the new [linuxserver/pyload-ng](https://github.com/linuxserver/docker-pyload-ng/) docker container, which is currently at version `0.5.0b2.dev11`.

title: API AddPackage not working
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE -->
I'm using pyLoad for a while. Now I switched to pyLoad ng.  I have a LinkGrabber written in Python which uses the API to add Packages. Nowadays it doesnt work anymore.  I'm sending it via the requests package using the post method:
```
def sendFile(self,link):
        payload={'username':self.username,'password':self.password}
        with requests.session() as s: 
            r=s.post("http://"+self.char.pyLoadAdress+":"+str(self.char.pyLoadPort)+'/api/login', data=payload)
            print(r.text)
            payload={'name':self.char.getname(link),'links':[link]}
            payloadJSON = {k: json.dumps(v) for k, v in payload.items()}
            r = s.post("http://"+self.char.pyLoadAdress+":"+str(self.char.pyLoadPort)+'/api/addPackage', data=payloadJSON)
            r.close()
```

title: Error messages when download from uploaded.
body:
Hi,

I get these error messages when downloaded from Uploaded: Operation to slow. Less that 5 bytes/sec transferred in the last 60 seconds. The process is shown as "starting" in blue, but no download happens. I managed to finish on large download with multiple restarts, but this is really annoying. Gues this is a plugin issue. Contact me for further details. I upgraded to the lastest version on saturday by using "pip install --upgrade git+https://github.com/pyload/pyload.git@develop", but this did not change anything.

Yours sincerely
Stefan

title: Account valid for 11 weeks but pyload says its valid until tomorrow
body:
Hi,

I am using Pyload-NG installed via PIP on a fresh installation of Debian 11, so I have version 0.50.0 I already have downloaded multiple files with my uploaded premium account. I just added another batch of links and now it it demanding that I solve captchas. My account -  I deleted and recreated it multiple times - is saying that it is only valid until today in the web interface - but according to uploaded.net it is valid until for another 11 weeks. The log is already 1,2 MB in size so please tell me what keywords I should be grepping for. 

Yours
Stefan

title: Pyload Fails To Download Multiple Files In One Package From Rapidgator
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description

<!-- WRITE HERE -->
When trying to download a zip-file that is split into multiple links with a .001 ... 00X extension. Pyload only downloads the first file and then errors out the subsequent links in that package. However, when trying to download the links individually, pyload has no problem. Even when trying to restart the package after the firs one is complete it still errors out and does not start.

Only tested with Rapidgator and Youtube, youtube seems to work fine with multiple files however I assume the people is something to do with the files having the same name until the extension and not the plugins/hosters fault 

### Debug log
<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/dist-packages/pyload/core/threads/download_thread.py", line 56, in run
    pyfile.plugin.preprocessing(self)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/dist-packages/pyload/plugins/base/hoster.py", line 300, in preprocessing
    return self._process(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/dist-packages/pyload/plugins/base/downloader.py", line 104, in _process

    self.check_duplicates()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/dist-packages/pyload/plugins/base/downloader.py", line 535, in check_duplicates
    dl_n = int(m.group(2) or "0")
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'group'
```

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->


<!-- Any other reference, related issues or pull requests about this report. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE - OPTIONAL -->

### Screenshots
<!-- Any screenshot that can help to explain your problem. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE - OPTIONAL -->

The All 3 test is all 3 of the zip files together in one package, and as you can see it had no problem downloading the first one but, then failed the other two.

However, if the other two links are added individually, they download fine as seen in the "Rapidgator 2 Part" and "Rapidgator 3rd Part" folders.

Please let me know if you need any other info.

Thank You!

title: Unable to start Pyload Next when insalled via Pip (ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'pyload.core.config')
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
<!-- WRITE HERE -->

I am trying to install pyload onto a headless ubuntu server running on a raspberry pi. I installed python and pip and proceeded to use the command `pip install pyload-ng[all]` to download and install pyload.

However when running `pyload` i get the following error:

```ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'pyload.core.config'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/ubuntu/.local/bin/pyload", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/home/ubuntu/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/script.py", line 124, in main
    run(core_args, args.daemon)
  File "/home/ubuntu/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/script.py", line 108, in run
    pyload_core = Core(*core_args)
  File "/home/ubuntu/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/core/__init__.py", line 91, in __init__
    self._init_config(userdir, cachedir, storagedir, debug)
  File "/home/ubuntu/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/core/__init__.py", line 107, in _init_config
    from .config.parser import ConfigParser
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'pyload.core.config'
```
I have seen this issue come up in #3540 which referenced a fix in #3428 however, this fix tells the user to use python 2.7 and the stable build of pyload. This might have worked but pip has dropped support for python 2.7 so I can't install the required modules to run the python2.7 version of pyload.

As the required modules can not be installed the fix in #3428 does not work.

I am unsure on what to do to get pyload up and running, any help is appreciated.

### Additional references
<!-- Any other reference, related issues or pull requests about this report. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE - OPTIONAL -->
Please let me know if you need any other information.

title: Plugin Turbobit no longer working -> switched to hcaptcha
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
Download via turbobit is no longer possible
Turbobit changed their captcha provider from gcaptcha to hcaptcha, therefore pyload errors out with "Captcha form not found" message.

Example link is here: https://turbobit.net/psdpp8cunw58.html
I tried another link, it came also up with hcaptcha, so I think it's a general change

This also affects the development branch

title: unsupported locale setting via xfs_account.py
body:
### Description
I am running `pyload-ng` on Raspberry Pi OS, installed via: https://github.com/pyload/pyload/wiki/Step-by-Step-Installation-(RaspberryPi) … After adding an account for DdownloadCom, I was not able to log in due to locales issues, it seems?

### Debug log
```
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: [2021-06-12 15:07:54]  INFO                pyload  ACCOUNT DdownloadCom: Adding user `**********`...
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: [2021-06-12 15:07:54]  DEBUG               pyload  ACCOUNT DdownloadCom: Reached login timeout for user `*******`

Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: [2021-06-12 15:07:54]  DEBUG               pyload  ACCOUNT DdownloadCom: LOAD URL https://ddownload.com/ | get={} | post={'op': 'login', 'token': 'XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: [2021-06-12 15:07:54]  INFO                pyload  ACCOUNT DdownloadCom: Checking for link errors...
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: [2021-06-12 15:07:54]  INFO                pyload  ACCOUNT DdownloadCom: No errors found
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: [2021-06-12 15:07:54]  INFO                pyload  ACCOUNT DdownloadCom: Grabbing account info for user `*******`...
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: [2021-06-12 15:07:54]  DEBUG               pyload  ACCOUNT DdownloadCom: LOAD URL http://www.ddownload.com/ | get={'op': 'my_account'} | post={} | ref=True | cookies=True |
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: [2021-06-12 15:07:54]  DEBUG               pyload  ACCOUNT DdownloadCom: Expire date: XX XXX XXXX
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: [2021-06-12 15:07:54]  ERROR               pyload  ACCOUNT DdownloadCom: unsupported locale setting
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: Traceback (most recent call last):
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/pyload/plugins/base/xfs_account.py", line 101, in grab_info
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]:     locale.setlocale(locale.LC_TIME, "en_US")
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]:   File "/usr/lib/python3.7/locale.py", line 604, in setlocale
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]:     return _setlocale(category, locale)
Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: locale.Error: unsupported locale setting

Jun 12 15:07:54 raspberry pyload[1410]: [2021-06-12 15:07:54]  DEBUG               pyload  ACCOUNT DdownloadCom: LEECH TRAFFIC PATTERN not found
```

### Additional references
This line seems to be the problem(?) …

https://github.com/pyload/pyload/blob/develop/src/pyload/plugins/base/xfs_account.py#L101

When changing `en_US` to `en_US.UTF-8` here, then it worked for me.

Maybe it should, by default, be changed to something like `C` to circumvent such errors?

title: encode/decode issues...
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
So I know there are already few suggestions flying around about this ascii<->utf-8 encoding/non-printable characters, but somehow the solutions described in https://github.com/pyload/pyload/issues/2291 &&  https://github.com/pyload/pyload/issues/3283 did not solve the issue for me. I still got "UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\ufffd' in position 48: ordinal not in range(128)"... 

So some debug statements, and few hours later, I eventually got a workaround, that fixed the issue for me. Basically the issue is that in the title of some links there are special chars(umlauts in my case). What I decided to do, is to replace these with an underscore. It's probably not nice (as the character is replaced), but it's functional and I anyway didn't like umlauts in the filename on my NAS.

I guess you might aim to fix this encoding issue the right way, but until that's happened, the below could save some people some headaches and take away some frustration.

PS: I really love the work you do here with pyload. It's pretty lightweight compared with other download managers... If you dislike people pokeing around in your code and send reports like this, let me know:).


in /opt/pyload/userplugins/internal/misc.py
`def decode(value, encoding=None, errors='strict'):
    """
    Encoded string (default to own system encoding) -> unicode string
    """
    if isinstance(value, str):
       
        #res = unicode(value, encoding or get_console_encoding(sys.stdout.encoding), errors)
        #res = unicode(value, encoding or get_console_encoding(sys.stdout.encoding), errors='ignore')
        res = unicode(value, encoding or 'cp1252', errors='ignore')`

in [CONFIGDIR]/userplugins/internal/Base.py
Note, nothing was replaced, just the lines after the # below
`...
import unicodedata, re, sys
...
   def grab_info(self):
        self.log_info(_("Grabbing link info..."))

        old_info = dict(self.info)
        new_info = self.get_info(replace_patterns(self.pyfile.url, self.URL_REPLACEMENTS), self.data)

        #update new_info by twt aka anon_helper:
        self.log_debug("twt: new info name is %s" % new_info['name'])
        encodinghack = new_info['name']

        encodinghack = encodinghack.replace(u'\ufffd', '_')

        self.log_debug("twt: what if we just call it %s" % encodinghack)

        new_info['name'] = encodinghack`




<!-- WRITE HERE -->

### Debug log
<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->
I should really slap myself... Sorry the logs were already rotated... I have however the debug reports if that's of any use to you.
I'm not used to report issues, I'm rather going and fixing stuff... Let me add the debug file, in the hope, that you have some useful information in case you decide to pursue this issue.
[debug_DdownloadCom_24-05-2021_10-59-31.zip](https://github.com/pyload/pyload/files/6550185/debug_DdownloadCom_24-05-2021_10-59-31.zip)

TRACEBACK:
 Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/share/pyload/module/PluginThread.py", line 187, in run
    pyfile.plugin.preprocessing(self)
  File "/opt/pyload/userplugins/internal/Base.py", line 291, in preprocessing
    return self._process(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/pyload/userplugins/internal/Hoster.py", line 118, in _process
    self.process(self.pyfile)
  File "/opt/pyload/userplugins/internal/SimpleHoster.py", line 253, in process
    self.log_info(_("pyfile" + str(pyfile)))
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\ufffd' in position 48: ordinal not in range(128)

```

body:
Hi everyone,
Unfortunately, pyload still causes me a lot of problems.
This time, after spending nearly 3 hours after downloading files that size is ~70GB (traffic goes through vpn so download speed is not satisfactory) it outputs an error:

As you can see there are two warnings and one error.
```
452	07.04.2021 14:08:05	WARNING	HOSTER BasePlugin[4]: Plugin may be unstable
450	07.04.2021 14:07:04	WARNING	Couldn't connect to host or connection reset, waiting 1 minute and retry.
462	07.04.2021 16:16:28	ERROR	Download chunks failed, fallback to single connection | (18, 'transfer closed with 2607217503 bytes remaining to read')
```

1) So if BasePlugin may be unstable why it is default plugin for download from Http server? Maybe you can recommend me something that will be more stable. Should I use ftp connection instead of http?
2) Regarding to inaccessible host - server's logs show that there were no problems with the availability of the server - so maybe it's related to vpn's tunnel?
3) That error irritates me the most. Firstly, In the network, we can find the information that this may refer to the lack of disk space which in my case can't be true because files are downloaded to an external disk that has more than 9TB space free. Secondly,  the files has been downloaded for over two hours and there was a small amount of data to complete download (+file is being downloaded in chunks) so why pyload starts download data from beginning instead of download missing bytes? 

Thank you in the advance for your help in solving the issues.

P.S. You can find [here](https://github.com/pyload/pyload/issues/3924) my config.

title: Error while processing content unencoding: incorrect header check
body:
Hi everyone!
First of all I would like to say that I find pyload as a great tool! Thanks a lot for multiarch support!
Unfortunately, downloading files from private sites (read as protected by http basic authentication) is a real pain...

Getting to the heart of the matter.
Address scheme of the url is as follows:
`https://serverid.domain.com/userId/download/filename.extension`

Of course, We need to provide login credentials to have access to this site.

So I followed these steps:
**1) HTTP basic authentication URL with “@” in password**
I tried to download file from path:
`https://user:password@serverid.domain.com/userId/download/filename.extension`

The only result I got was the following error:
```

title: Downloads hang in "starting"
body:
I very often see the following: I upload a DLC, things seem to go nicely. When I come back a while later, downloads have stopped but not all files are downloaded. The Queue shows them in "starting". When I retry they go into queued and download just fine. If I tag too many the first ones get downloaded, the rest goes into starting again.

Happens with all sorts of downloaders (RealDebrid, DDownload).

title: RealDebrid - No plugin is associated with torrents / magnets - but works when re-added
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

I'm using RealDebrid premium account to download torrents using magnet links. It usually works but sometimes I get error "No plugin is associated with torrents / magnets".

When error occurs, package *restart* is not helping. It simply generate returns same error again and again.

But when I copy the magnet URL of failed *Package* and add it again with same information, everything is working for new package.

From what I understand (or better "think") it happens when some error occurs with RealDebird servers or plugin. And it would be OK if *restart failed* would fix it later, but it doesn't.

I tried to play with code as I intended to send fix for this, but I failed. Probably don't understand the link states / workflow correctly.

Anyway from logs bellow my guess is, that when URL is decrypted, it progress to some new state which don't call decrypter correctly on next try? At least first line is different - in failed download it says that decrypting starts and there is only *link name*. But when I add new package, there is whole URL in *decrypting starts* phase.

If there is anything else I can provide to help fix this, let me know.

<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

title: AttributeError: 'HTMLParser' object has no attribute 'unescape'
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
Error occured when add download links.
Environment:
 1. Python 3.9
 2. Docker Debian Sid
 3. Installation using ```pip install --pre pyload-ng[all]```


<!-- WRITE HERE -->

### Debug log
<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

```
pyLoad 0.5.0 Debug Report of DefaultPlugin 0.52 

TRACEBACK:
 Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/debian/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/core/threads/download_thread.py", line 56, in run
    pyfile.plugin.preprocessing(self)
  File "/home/debian/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/plugins/base/hoster.py", line 304, in preprocessing
    return self._process(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/debian/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/plugins/base/downloader.py", line 90, in _process
    self._setup()
  File "/home/debian/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/plugins/base/hoster.py", line 175, in _setup
    self.grab_info()
  File "/home/debian/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/plugins/base/hoster.py", line 236, in grab_info
    new_info = self.get_info(self.pyfile.url, self.data)
  File "/home/debian/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/plugins/base/hoster.py", line 48, in get_info
    url = fixurl(url, unquote=True)
  File "/home/debian/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/core/utils/old/__init__.py", line 113, in fixurl
    url = html_unescape(url)
  File "/home/debian/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pyload/core/utils/old/__init__.py", line 156, in html_unescape
    return h.unescape(text)
AttributeError: 'HTMLParser' object has no attribute 'unescape'

```

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

### Additional references
<!-- Any other reference, related issues or pull requests about this report. -->
HTMLParser.unescape is removed. It was undocumented and deprecated since Python 3.4.
https://docs.python.org/release/3.9.0/whatsnew/changelog.html
https://bugs.python.org/issue37328
https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/8dd430265ccd4d34b74c841d6bcc8f58aa93ad94

title: [Plugin] Multiple problems with ExtractArchive Plugin
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
a) After download of some rarfiles (maybe rar5 format?) unrar is reporting in pyload a `utf-16-le' codec can't decode byte` error (from commandline the exctractcommand works fine)
b) unzip extract isn't respecting the `Extract archives ending with extension` setting. This causes epub files (as they are in reality zip files) to be extracted if they are included in another archive format, like in the given example below

I'm having the following setting applied to the ExtractArchive plugin
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6438895/110245999-14f62700-7f66-11eb-9e1c-31f30b9e30f0.png)

I'm running this configuration, with the newest commit of development branch (but as I remember this problem was also existing on stable version 0.4.20. 
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6438895/110246066-538be180-7f66-11eb-870e-f6b8030d170f.png)

The problem can be reproduced by downloading this file: https://rapidgator.net/file/68574638058b2ffbd77bc77bace1e41b
It's a approx. 5MB Rar5 file with epub file in it.

[2021-03-07 10:22:35]  DEBUG               pyload  ADDON ExternalScripts: No script found under folder `package_extract_failed`

```

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

### Additional references
<!-- Any other reference, related issues or pull requests about this report. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE - OPTIONAL -->

a) 
From my point of view the decode error can be fixed by replacing all occourences of  

`out, err = (to_str(r, "utf-16").strip() if r else "" for r in p.communicate())`  

in unrar.py file with  

`out, err = (to_str(r, "utf-16").strip() if r else "" for r in **p.communicate())`

But utf-16 looks strange enough to be intentional.

b) The cause for this is because unzip is overloading the `isarchive` function in unzip.py (line 37 to 50) and this function isn't respecting the EXTENSION settings. By just deleting the function in unzip.py the code is working as intended. 

### Screenshots
<!-- Any screenshot that can help to explain your problem. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE - OPTIONAL -->

title: Incorrect display of the pyLoad Favicon iOS 14
body:
Would this little cosmetic improvement be possible?

On Linux, Windows or MacOS machines, the favicon is displayed correctly by all common browsers.
Unfortunately, this is not the case with iOS 14 and iPadOS 14, the favicon is displayed distorted.

Here are examples from Google Chrome and Apple Safari under iPadOS 14.

[https://i.imgur.com/woqOByk.png](url)

[https://i.imgur.com/N9nn21K.png](url)

title: Confusing unit for max download speed
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE -->
The unit given in the description for the "Max Download Speed" (Config -> Download) is "kb/s" which should translate to kilo**bit** per second. I wanted to limit speed to ~4,5 megabyte per second so I set this value to 36000.
But it still downloaded with speeds way above 4,5 MB/s.

I set it to 4500 and it did download at roughly 4,5 megabyte per second after that.

So I guess that this value is not kilo**bit** per second (k**b**/s) as it's stated in the description but actually kilo**byte** per second which would be k**B**/s. This should be fixed in the description text.

Maybe even write it out so it's clear what the unit is. Megabyte per second (MB/s) as a float might also be more useful and coherent for most users today.

(Please ignore my ignorance towards the MiB vs MB difference here.^^)

title: ClickNLoad urls are separated by spaces instead of new line.
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

When I use ClickNLoad on Serialjunkies, it adds a package with only one link to download, with all links separated by a space. When the download begins, the download fails because of an invalid link.

Note: I have configured ssh port forwarding which redirects the request to my pyload instance.

I have analyzed the code a bit and found a location where the problem can be fixed.

```
module/web/cnl_app.py
40: - urls = [x.decode('latin1').strip() for x in request.POST['urls'].split("\n") if x.decode('latin1').strip()]
40: + urls = [x.decode('latin1').strip() for x in re.split("\n|\s", request.POST['urls']) if x.decode('latin1').strip()]

title: Links from MultiUpOrg crypter ending in different package
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description

Conditions:

- Multiple interchangeable links leading to same file are stored on different *Hosters*. 
- FileName is often hard to decipher. Something like `SomeSite.io_dbust70am64net.iso` which is in fact `debian-10.7.0-amd64-netinst.iso`
- Premium account on Real-Debrid

Now my approach is to to fill correct filename (`debian-10.7.0-amd64-netinst.iso`) into *Package Name* when I'm adding these links to *Package* so I can later rename downloaded file according to the directory name.

My problem occurs when one of the *Hosters* is *MultiUpload*. What happens is that the *MultiUpload crypter* produce additional links and create new *Package* with name created from file name. So instead of single (and correct) package:

- `debian-10.7.0-amd64-netinst.iso`

I end up with two packages:

- `debian-10.7.0-amd64-netinst.iso`
- `SomeSite.io_dbust70am64net.iso`

IMHO *MultiUpload crypter* should add discovered/decrypted links to same package where link leading to decryption was.

I belive that I can somehow work around it with setting `folder` but it would
be still problem as when I move completed *Package* away and delete it through
API, second package would start downloading same file again or stick in queue
with failed status or something.

If I'm just not seeing something obvious, please let me knnow.

<!-- WRITE HERE -->

### Debug log
<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

title: Unable to use pyload for torrents through flexget
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description

I have kind of working *flexget*/*pyload* setup with RSS feeds and classic
hosters with help of *RealDebrid* account.

What I wanted to make it better is to use discover with torrents or some
torrents RSS feeds and then use *RealDebrid's* torrent feature to download it
through *pyload*.

It seems that *flexget* is trying to use `parseURLs` endpoint through `html`
attribute to validate links that are ok but *pyload* can't handle `magnet` ones.

I'm not sure if it is better handled on *flexget's* side or *pyload's*, but it seems to me
that as *pyload* can handle `magnet` links through UI, it should be able to do
through API too.

If you need additional details, let me know.

<!-- WRITE HERE -->

### Debug log
<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

Using latest `stable` branch and latest `flexget`.

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

```
2020-12-07 18:34:32 DEBUG    pyload        discover-series-test Parsing url "magnet:?xt=urn:btih:xxxx.....%2Fannounce"
2020-12-07 18:34:32 DEBUG    utils.requests discover-series-test POSTing URL http://localhost:8000/api/parseURLs with args () and kwargs {'data': {'html': '" magnet%3A%3Fxt%3Durn%3Abtih%3Axxxx....announce"', 'url': '"magnet:?xt=urn:btih:xxxxxx......announce"', 'session': 'abcdefgh'}, 'json': None, 'timeout': 30}
2020-12-07 18:34:32 CRITICAL task          discover-series-test BUG: Unhandled error in plugin pyload: 500 Server Error: Internal Server Error for url: http://localhost:8000/api/parseURLs requests.exceptions.HTTPError: 500 Server Error: Internal Server Error for url: http://localhost:8000/api/parseURLs
2020-12-07 18:34:32 CRITICAL manager       discover-series-test An unexpected crash has occurred. Writing crash report to /home/filmiky/.config/flexget/crash_report.2020.12.07.183432459168.log. Please verify you are running the latest version of flexget by using "flexget -V" from CLI or by using version_checker plugin at http://flexget.com/wiki/Plugins/version _checker. You are currently using version 3.1.33
2020-12-07 18:34:32 DEBUG    manager       discover-series-test Traceback: requests.exceptions.HTTPError: 500 Server Error: Internal Server Error for url: http://localhost:8000/api/parseURLs
2020-12-07 18:34:32 WARNING  task          discover-series-test Aborting task (plugin: pyload)
```

This can be easily reproduced with using same approach through API manually, i.e.:

```python
import requests
payload_login = {'username': 'flexget', 'password': 'superpassword....'}
rs = requests.post('http://localhost:8000/api/login', data=payload_login, json=None, timeout=30 )
session_id = rs.json
payload = {'html': '" magnet%3A%3Fxt%3Durn%3Abtih%3Axxxxxx..........announce"', 'session': session_id}
rs = requests.post('http://localhost:8000/api/parseURLs', data=payload, json=None, timeout=30)
```

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

<!-- WRITE IN HERE -->

### Additional references
Here is the install script I used to install pyload-ng. Specifically I used replaced some
dependencies in the setup.cfg which are only available in newer version on Arch Linux.
```
pkgname='pyload-ng'
pkgver='0.5.0a5.dev528'
pkgrel=1
pkgdesc='The free and open-source Download Manager written in pure Python'
arch=('any')
url='https://pyload.net/'
license=('AGPL')
depends=(
        'python'
        'python-cheroot'
        'python-flask'
        'python-flask-babel'
        'python-flask-caching'
        'python-flask-themes2'
        'python-bitmath'
        'python-cryptography'
        'python-filetype'
        'python-js2py'
        'python-pycurl'
        'python-semver'
        'python-requests-html'
        'python-cryptography'
)
makedepends=('python-setuptools')
source=("https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/source/${pkgname::1}/$pkgname/$pkgname-$pkgver.zip")
sha256sums=('5e08f578296be49014437b3f9a581a3ac564ef69b3c9a020913abcceaa4b54a2')

build() {
        cd "$pkgname-$pkgver"
        sed -i 's/Flask-Babel~=1.0/Flask-Babel~=2.0/g' setup.cfg
        sed -i 's/cryptography~=2.4/cryptography~=3.0/g' setup.cfg
        sed -i 's/Cheroot~=6.5/Cheroot~=8.0/g' setup.cfg
        python setup.py build
}

package() {
        cd "$pkgname-$pkgver"
        python setup.py install --root="$pkgdir" --optimize=1 --skip-build
}
```

title: Pyload configuration rendered differently among multiple restarts
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Description
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

Pyload 0.4.20 renders the following part of configuration during first start:
```
classic;pyplex;modern template : "Template" = modern
```

After multiple restarts, Pyload 0.4.20 rerenders the above line to the following:

```
classic;modern;pyplex template : "Template" = modern
```

I think the line will be rerendered only, after some Plugins have been updated to a specific version. The Plugin causing this behavior or the concrete version of it is currently not known.

### Debug log
<!-- Remember to enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

I tried to find some useful information in debug log, why this behaviour changed. However, there is no hint in the logs, referencing this issue.

### Additional references
<!-- Any other reference, related issues or pull requests about this report. -->

None.

### Additional Information

Maybe it would be a good idea, to avoid rendering the config over and over again during Pyload start. Is there any requirement of a specific order in config file? Can this behavior somehow skipped?

title: [Main] Fix ip address not resolvable on reconnect
body:
<!-- ANNOTATIONS LIKE THIS WILL NOT BE VISIBLE IN YOUR TICKET -->

### Describe the changes

On every reconnect the function first tries to get the ip address from the service http://automation.whatismyip.com, this page is no longer existent, I exchanged it with a working one: icanhazip.com (using this for years now).
Second problem is that get_url returns a binary, so the following regex fails, changing the regex strings to binary ones solves this problem.

### Is this related to a problem?

On a reconnect the fields for the ip address have been empty before:
```

```

After appling the patch PR #3753 the download fails with the following traceback. I tried to debug it, got different errors. To me it looks like the download gets started several times in parallel.

title: [Main] Actions fail after restart of pyload NG
body:
### Description

If you start pyload NG, open the pyload page in your browser (tested with firefox) stop pyload NG and restart it and afterwards try to issue something which is done via ajax requests this requests will all fail. To avoid this problem you have to reload the page before (this refreshs the session, I guess) and than everything works.

### Debug log

Edit: Forgot the debug log:

title: [Main] Login with password with umlauts (äöü) not possible
body:
### Description
If the password has umlauts in it, it's no longer possible to login with this pasword.
Change theme to pyPlex (as Default theme is currently not working on this page)
Start pyload
Go to admin page, change password of current admin user to e.g: 'ögo'
Logout and try to login -> login not possible

(I guess unicode characters like chinese letters wont work, too)

### Debug log
No outputs in the debug log

### Additional references
The problem is also in pyload 4.20, during my migration to python3 attempt I fixed this, it was related to an encoding problem, as far as I remember.

### Screenshots
N/A

title: Extract problems - Active Downloads error
body:
Hi,

I saw a error yesterday, which I can't reproduce. But I saw it many times before. Maybe some other person will find the reason for this problem.

When I load packages with mulitple files (>20), then I download it with 5 parallel downloads and 3 parallel connections.
Often when I look into the pyload web-ui, I see active Downloads which are freezed by 99%.  Even after some days.
But if I look into the download folder there are just whole *.rar files.

If this problem occurs, it can happen that some files are damaged. 
If I remove them from the directory and trigger a new download, pyload downloads the file, finishs the download and produces a illegal file again.
Then I need to restart pyload to download the correct files.

Next time I see this problem, I will make some screenshots and I will observe it more. 
Until then I just wanted to create this report...

T

I'm using the latest version of `pyload-nightly` available in the AUR, which follows [this installation process](https://aur.archlinux.org/cgit/aur.git/tree/PKGBUILD?h=pyload-nightly). I created a system user with home in /var/lib/pyload to run it as a daemon.

title: Alfafile plugin doesn't detect daily download limit properly
body:
<!-- Hey, annotations like this one will not be visible in your ticket, just ignore them all. -->

### Describe the problem
`Parse error: No file downloaded | Plugin may be out of date` shows up in the web ui caused by dailt download limit.

I looked at [the code (Line 83)](https://github.com/pyload/pyload/blob/stable/module/plugins/hoster/AlfafileNet.py#L83), it detects "...download limit", but Alfafile uses the word "download**s** limit"

### Debug log
<!-- Enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE BELOW -->
I will attach a .txt file instead.
Also note that I have to censor my 9kw.eu API key, other than that the log is what it is.
[debug_log.txt](https://github.com/pyload/pyload/files/4776359/debug_log.txt)

### Screenshots
<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->
![](https://i.imgur.com/tzYE2Zh.png)
<!-- WRITE HERE - OPTIONAL -->


### Additional references
<!-- Any other context, related issues or pull requests about the problem. -->
I was able to know what server responded with the following command.

    curl 'https://alfafile.net/download/start_timer/(Alfafile ID)' -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:77.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/77.0' -H 'Accept: application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01' --compressed -H 'X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest' -H 'Connection: keep-alive' -H 'Referer: https://alfafile.net/file/JsHA' -H 'DNT: 1' -H 'TE: Trailers'

which lets me know that daily download limit message isn't detected correctly.
<!-- WRITE HERE - OPTIONAL -->

title: Apprise notifications bug?
body:
Hi, I have tested the plugin "Apprise Notification" and yop I think it needs a code review.

From the openwrt command line it works.

I do not understand programming but I think that the lines of the file "AppriseNotify.py" are wrong according to the web.

**On "AppriseNotify.py":**
      import apprise
        apprise_obj = apprise.Apprise()
        apprise_config = apprise.AppriseConfig()
        for c in key:
            apprise_config.add(c)
        apprise_obj.add(apprise_config)
        apprise_obj.notify(title=self.config.get("title"),
                           body="%s: %s" % (event, msg) if msg else event)


**On WEB:**
import apprise
apobj = apprise.Apprise()
apobj.add('json://localhost/tagA/', tag="TagA")
# Add 2 tags by string; the comma and/or space auto delimit
# our entries (spaces and comma's are ignored):
apobj.add('json://localhost/tagAB/', tag="TagA, TagB")
# Add 2 tags using a list; this works with tuples and sets too!
apobj.add('json://localhost/tagCD/', tag=["TagC", "TagD"])



WEB:
https://github.com/caronc/apprise/wiki/Development_API

Thanks

title: Call to API statusServer results in HTTP 500 error
body:
<!-- Hey, annotations like this one will not be visible in your ticket, just ignore them all. -->

### Describe the problem
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->
API calls to latest (stable) docker image results in an HTTP 500 Status error. 


<!-- WRITE HERE -->
I am using docker images from the hub: https://hub.docker.com/r/linuxserver/pyload/tags

the last working image: 

> linuxserver/pyload:9ea07eef-ls20 _ buildtime: 2:01pm

afterwards (including the latest one) the example code below no longer works:

> linuxserver/pyload:344086b9-ls20 _ buildtime: 4:58pm

unfortunately I cannot narrow it down exactly but it looks like the commit https://github.com/pyload/pyload/commit/2e9272ab8112157814310e0e517bf3bf3e4cae01 for fixing #3578 is responsible for this.

### Debug log
<!-- Enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE BELOW -->
The docker logs show the follow error message:

```
/app/pyload/module/web/api_app.py:65: DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6
  return HTTPError(500, json.dumps({"error": e.message, "traceback": format_exc()}))
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/app/pyload/module/web/api_app.py", line 62, in call_api
    return callApi(func, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/app/pyload/module/web/api_app.py", line 74, in callApi
    **dict([(x, literal_eval(y)) for x, y in kwargs.iteritems()]))
  File "/app/pyload/module/lib/SafeEval.py", line 44, in const_eval
    c = test_expr(expr, _const_codes)
  File "/app/pyload/module/lib/SafeEval.py", line 33, in test_expr
    raise ValueError, "%s is not a valid expression" % expr
ValueError:  is not a valid expression
```


### Additional references
<!-- Any other context, related issues or pull requests about the problem. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE - OPTIONAL -->
Exampe script:

```python 
"""testing pyload api."""
import requests
from requests.packages.urllib3.exceptions import InsecureRequestWarning

requests.packages.urllib3.disable_warnings(InsecureRequestWarning)

username = "admin"
password = "****"
url = "https://****:8001/api/"
payload = {"username": username, "password": password}
login = requests.post(
    "{}{}".format(url, "login"), data=payload, timeout=5, verify=False)
print(login.cookies)

payload = {"method": "speed"}
response = requests.post(
    "{}{}".format(url, "statusServer"),
    json=payload,
    cookies=login.cookies,
    timeout=5,
    verify=False
)
print(response)
response.raise_for_status()
print(response.json())

```

title: Bad server response: 400 Bad Request
body:
<!-- Hey, annotations like this one will not be visible in your ticket, just ignore them all. -->

### Describe the problem
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

I am running pyload (headless) on a RPi with captcha9kw behind a FreshTomato router (3400v3). The 3400v3 sits behind another router. This is working perfectly fine (captchas are getting solved automatically and downloads complete as expected). I am primarily downloading from UL and RG. 

The problem starts when activating the openvpn client on the FreshTomato (3400v3) router. I am using cyberghost (udp). The vpn connection starts fine and I seem to continue to have unlimited connectivity. 

However, as soon as the VPN connection is established pyload stop to work properly. The captcha doesn't get solved and I immediately receive a 400 Bad Request error. This happens with both, UL and RG (both require reCaptcha). And I have also test with NitroFlare and am receiving the same error.

I have tested on my Win10 machine which is hooked up to the same 3400v3. There everything is working fine, even when the VPN is active on the Freshtomato router. Hence I assume it must be a pyload issue.

Did a complete reinstall of the raspberry and pyload. Same behaviour when VPN enabled...

I am not sure if this is related to reCaptcha or something else.
Also I am not sure why this is only occurring when behind VPN - without VPN everything works just fine.

title: DDL.to's Captchas are unsolvable due to too small surrounding <div>
body:
### Problem Description

When I try to download a file from DDL.to the `<div id ="cap_iframe_clipping">` will not be resized properly, rendering the Captcha unsolvable.

Since I have not experienced this problem with other hosters, I suspect this is a problem with the DdlTo plugin.

### Screenshots
![2020-04-27-171721_247x293_scrot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7914030/80389207-11f0cb80-88ab-11ea-90d7-1c71ea2b86f5.png)

### Log
```
27.04.2020 17:16:53	WARNING	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: Plugin may be unstable
27.04.2020 17:16:53	INFO	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: Grabbing link info...
27.04.2020 17:16:54	INFO	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: Link name: *snip*
27.04.2020 17:16:54	INFO	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: Link size: *snip* MiB (*snip* bytes)
27.04.2020 17:16:54	INFO	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: Link status: online
27.04.2020 17:16:54	INFO	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: Processing url: https://ddownload.com/*snip*
27.04.2020 17:16:54	INFO	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: Checking for link errors...
27.04.2020 17:16:54	INFO	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: No errors found
27.04.2020 17:16:54	INFO	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: Processing as free download...
27.04.2020 17:16:54	INFO	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: Checking for link errors...
27.04.2020 17:16:54	INFO	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: No errors found
27.04.2020 17:16:54	WARNING	CAPTCHA DdlTo[55]: ReCaptcha | Secure Token pattern not found
27.04.2020 17:16:54	WARNING	CAPTCHA DdlTo[55]: ReCaptcha | Secure Token pattern not found
27.04.2020 17:16:54	WARNING	CAPTCHA DdlTo[55]: ReCaptcha | reCAPTCHA noscript is blocked, trying reCAPTCHA interactive
27.04.2020 17:17:52	INFO	CAPTCHA DdlTo[55]: ReCaptcha | Captcha result: `*snip*`
27.04.2020 17:17:52	INFO	HOSTER DdlTo[55]: Downloading file... 
```


### Additional references
As a workaround I use my browser's inspector feature to manually extend the div's size:
```
document.getElementById('cap_iframe_clipping').style.width = '500px';
document.getElementById('cap_iframe_clipping').style.height = '500px';
```

title: Pyload

I have just finished to install a fresh Pyload installation with the last release.

title: error: [Errno 32] Broken pipe and error: [Errno 131] Connection reset by peer
body:
Hello!!, in the last days I have this error and in a certain time pyload closes, but I cannot find information why it may be.

pyload is installed on a xioami 3g router with openwrt version 19.07.2

Thank you

title: Add option for intermediate certificate chain

milestone.title: pyLoad Next
milestone.description:
Future Release.

- All plugins updated
- Critical bugs fixup
- New UpdateManager
- New config module
- New git structure
- No setup
- Fix SSL support
- Full code refactoring
- PyPI support
- Update built-in Python 2.x to latest
- Update built-in lib to latest
- Update built-in unrar to latest

body:
<!-- Hey, annotations like this one will not be visible in your ticket, just ignore them all. -->

### Add option to provide an intermediate certificate
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

when starting the threaded webserver with an certificate, browsers like chrome or firefox may connect successfully when using a fullchain cerficiate. Other lclients like curl or openssl, which are used heavingly in automations, do not accept this certificate due to the missing certificate chain.

a proposed change is to add `certificate_chain` parameter to https://github.com/pyload/pyload/blob/master/src/pyload/webui/webserver_thread.py#L50

<!-- WRITE HERE -->
Test your installation:

`openssl s_client -connect your.domain.com:8001`

    Certificate chain
     0 s:CN = your.domain.com
       i:C = US, O = Let's Encrypt, CN = Let's Encrypt Authority X3

but should be:

    Certificate chain
     0 s:CN = your.domain.com
       i:C = US, O = Let's Encrypt, CN = Let's Encrypt Authority X3
     1 s:C = US, O = Let's Encrypt, CN = Let's Encrypt Authority X3
       i:O = Digital Signature Trust Co., CN = DST Root CA X3

### Additional references
<!-- Any other context, related issues or pull requests about the problem. -->
<!-- WRITE HERE - OPTIONAL -->
duplicates that were closed but not fixed:
https://github.com/pyload/pyload/issues/3210
https://github.com/pyload/pyload/issues/2386
https://github.com/pyload/pyload/issues/1809
ssl adapter reference:
https://docs.cherrypy.org/projects/cheroot/en/latest/pkg/cheroot.ssl.builtin.html

body:
<!-- Hey, annotations like this one will not be visible in your ticket, just ignore them all. -->

### Describe the problem
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE -->
When going to the Downloads-tab in the web interface with the web browser to retrieve larger files that finished downloading, pyLoad is trying gzip the file (as is requested in the headers with "Accept-Encoding" by default from most web browsers, e.g. Chrome/Opera/Edge, same if you force gzip-compression with wget). If files are big enough, they will cause pyLoad or at the least the gzipping to crash due to being out of memory. It doesn't crash and download fine if you force the browser not to use gzip-compression.

Problem exists both when running builtin or threaded web server. On Linux, the whole pyLoad crashes, no error message displayed. When running pyLoad on Windows, browser shows the debug log.

### Debug log
<!-- Enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE BELOW -->
Error in web interface (nothing appearing in console log):
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "D:\pyload-0420\pyload\dist\module\lib\wsgiserver\__init__.py", line 1174, in communicate
  File "D:\pyload-0420\pyload\dist\module\lib\wsgiserver\__init__.py", line 544, in respond
  File "D:\pyload-0420\pyload\dist\module\lib\wsgiserver\__init__.py", line 556, in _respond
  File "D:\pyload-0420\pyload\dist\.\module\web\middlewares.py", line 55, in __call__
  File "D:\pyload-0420\pyload\dist\.\module\web\middlewares.py", line 121, in finish_response
  File "gzip.pyc", line 240, in write
MemoryError: out of memory
```

### Additional references
<!-- Any other context, related issues or pull requests about the problem. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE - OPTIONAL -->
PyLoad 0.4.20. Python 2.7.17, both Linux (Ubuntu) and Windows are affected.

title: Can't log out on Feb 29th
body:
<!-- Hey, annotations like this one will not be visible in your ticket, just ignore them all. -->

### Describe the problem
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE -->
Logging out from the webinterface on February 29th doesn't work. It shows "An Error occured, please enable debug mode to get more details. HTTP Response 500" and the user stays logged in.

### Debug log
<!-- Enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE BELOW -->
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/usr/share/pyload/module/lib/bottle.py", line 733, in _handle
return route.call(**args)
File "/usr/share/pyload/module/lib/bottle.py", line 1448, in wrapper
rv = callback(*a, **ka)
File "/usr/share/pyload/module/web/pyload_app.py", line 235, in logout
s.delete()
File "/usr/share/pyload/module/lib/beaker/session.py", line 594, in delete
self._session().delete()
File "/usr/share/pyload/module/lib/beaker/session.py", line 196, in delete
self._delete_cookie()
File "/usr/share/pyload/module/lib/beaker/session.py", line 186, in _delete_cookie
expires = datetime.today().replace(year=2003)
ValueError: day is out of range for month
```

### Additional references
<!-- Any other context, related issues or pull requests about the problem. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE - OPTIONAL -->
As it turns out, 2003 isn't a leap year. So February in 2003 doesn't have 29 days, thus "day is out of range for month". Simplest solution seems to be to replace `expires = datetime.today().replace(year=2003)` with `expires = datetime.today().replace(year=2004)` in line 186 `pyload/module/lib/beaker/session.py`, since 2004 was a leap year. I tried this and it works.

Of course, this bug will only occur today and every next 4 years for one day 😉

EDIT: More elegant solution is probably to use a relative date. E.g. the following line fixes it as well, even if you would reset your system clock to <=2004:
`expires = datetime.today() - timedelta(days=1)`

title: Downloads fail due to string formatting.
body:
<!-- Hey, annotations like this one will not be visible in your ticket, just ignore them all. -->

### Describe the problem
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE -->
Pyload 0.4.20 is unable to start any downloads due to the returned traffic left value can't be converted to a number for logging and throws a type error.
Error occours in Hoster.py in line 397,
traffic value is '2.29669978524e+12'
and  '2.09 TiB' after beeing formatted by format_size().


Quickfix for me was to change line 399 of Hoster.py
from:
'''
_("Traffic left for user '%s': %d) % (self.account.user, format(traffic)))
'''

to:
'''
_("Traffic left for user '{}': {}".format(self.account.user, format(traffic)))
'''

### Debug log
<!-- Enable `Debug Mode` in pyload's general settings. -->

<!-- WRITE HERE BELOW -->
```

TRACEBACK:
 Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/share/pyload/module/PluginThread.py", line 187, in run
    pyfile.plugin.preprocessing(self)
  File "/usr/share/pyload/module/plugins/internal/Base.py", line 294, in preprocessing
    return self._process(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/share/pyload/module/plugins/internal/MultiHoster.py", line 64, in _process
    SimpleHoster._process(self, thread)
  File "/usr/share/pyload/module/plugins/internal/Hoster.py", line 118, in _process
    self.process(self.pyfile)
  File "/usr/share/pyload/module/plugins/internal/SimpleHoster.py", line 276, in process
    if self.premium and (not self.CHECK_TRAFFIC or not self.out_of_traffic()):
  File "/usr/share/pyload/module/plugins/internal/Hoster.py", line 397, in out_of_traffic
    _("Traffic left for user `%s`: %d") % (self.account.user, format_size(traffic)))
TypeError: %d format: a number is required, not str
 

FRAMESTACK:

Frame preprocessing in /usr/share/pyload/module/plugins/internal/Base.py at line 294
	                self = <Hoster PremiumTo>
	                args = (<DownloadThread(Thread-2, started daemon 1957950560)>,)
	              kwargs = {}

Frame _process in /usr/share/pyload/module/plugins/internal/MultiHoster.py at line 81
	                self = <Hoster PremiumTo>
